results.title: Biology program; unit 3. Animal life
results.brief_description: Series of programs intended for upper secondary level students. Introduces the study of animal life and provides examples of structure, life cycle, behavior and adaptation of various animal groups, eg amphibians, mammals, reptiles etc.

results.title: Biologica (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM has been designed as a learning and reference tool. The content has beeen selected to fulfil the requirements of most senior high school and introductory university courses in biology. Using the most recent research from universities, it features textual as well as audio and video information to explain concepts and theories, it also includes electron micrographs containing highlighted sections of diagrams, a dictionary of all terms used in the text and hypertext linked information. Includes detail on cell structure, photosynthesis, absorption of nutrients, molecular biology, reproduction, genetics, evolution and more…

results.title: Biography of the unborn
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the human foetus from conception to birth. Charts, animated drawings, x-rays and photomicrographs show the process of fertilization, the division of cells, the nourishment of the embryo, the development of internal organs, and the nervous system, and other phases of development which take place during the gestation period.

results.title: Biography of an atomic vet
results.creator_credit: Richard Schmiechen, Television Laboratory, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Nick Mazzuco
results.brief_description: A personal account of one man’s involvement in the above ground atomic tests that took place in the United States during the 1950’s. Nick Mazzucco recalls the growing awareness of the massive ignorance and indifference of the government in the acceptance of ‘safe radiation levels’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Schmiechen, Television Laboratory, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Nick Mazzuco

results.title: Biochemistry and molecular structure
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the role of molecular structure in determining biological activity. Shows correlation of structure and biological activity of sulfanilamide with a vitamin essential to bacterial growth as one example, then considers the effect on human cell growth of compounds similar to some found in cell chromosomes. Time-lapse photography shows the effect of one such compound, 5-fluorouracil, on growth of cancer cells. No other credits available.
